Tagline: The most famous animated band on earth
Bio: Gorillaz is a British virtual band created in 1998 by musician Damon Albarn and artist Jamie Hewlett. Known for their genre-blending sound that incorporates elements of rock, hip-hop, electronic, and world music, the band has achieved global success with hits like 'Clint Eastwood' and 'Feel Good Inc.' and has won multiple awards, including a Grammy.
My take: Gorillaz's innovative fusion of diverse musical styles, combined with their unique virtual band concept and visually striking animated personas, has made them a groundbreaking act in modern music. Their ability to collaborate with a wide range of artists has kept their sound fresh and relevant over decades.
Festival Bio (EN): Almost three decades in, the adventures of 2D, Murdoc Niccals, Russel Hobbs and Noodle have guided us across Plastic Beaches and Cracker Islands, and now in its ninth episode, clambering up The Mountain. Indeed, the novelty of starting an animated band became so much more for founders Damon Albarn and Jamie Hewlett. Behind the celluloid, Gorillaz has become a cross-generational, genre-blending community of legends and current greats – as glorious and vital as ever.

Bio: Jack White is an American musician, singer, and songwriter best known as the frontman of The White Stripes. Renowned for his raw, blues-inspired guitar work and innovative production, he has also achieved success with other projects like The Raconteurs and The Dead Weather, as well as a prolific solo career.
My take: Jack White's ability to fuse vintage blues and garage rock with modern sensibilities has made him a defining figure in 21st-century rock music. His innovative guitar techniques and commitment to analog recording have earned him critical acclaim and a lasting influence on the genre.
Festival Bio (EN): A legendary guitar hero in days where that concept seems rarer and rarer, Jack White never plays it safe.

Tagline: Legendary songsmith of darkness and devotion
Bio: Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds are an Australian rock band formed in 1983, known for their dark, brooding sound that blends post-punk, gothic rock, and blues influences. Fronted by the enigmatic Nick Cave, the band has released critically acclaimed albums like 'Murder Ballads' and 'The Boatman's Call,' earning a reputation for their poetic lyricism and intense live performances.
My take: Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds are celebrated for their ability to merge haunting narratives with a dynamic range of musical styles, from raw, visceral energy to melancholic balladry, making them one of the most influential acts in alternative music.
Festival Bio (EN): Menacing, majestic and often-times touching the divine, they have one of the most acclaimed back catalogs around. Nick Cave's ability to veer from blackened goth punk sermons to a tender-hearted gospel ballad is no longer a secret so well kept. After a thunderous show in 2022, Nick Cave and the Bad Seeds return to Hilvarenbeek with hymns of faith, hope and carnage both new and old.

Bio: ∑tella is a Greek indie pop artist known for her unique blend of dreamy synth-pop and electronic beats, often incorporating elements of traditional Greek music into her sound. She has gained recognition for her captivating vocals and intricate production, releasing music through prominent indie labels like Sub Pop.
My take: ∑tella's music stands out for its fusion of ethereal synth textures with subtle nods to her Greek heritage, creating a sound that is both modern and rooted in tradition. Her ability to craft atmospheric yet accessible tracks has earned her a growing international audience.
Festival Bio (EN): In Greek songwriter Σtella’s music, you can literally smell the sea air and the dizzy spells of unspoken attraction.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Belgian formation Ão’s debut album ‘Ao Mar’ is Portuguese for ‘to the sea’.It’s hard to imagine a more apt way to describe their enchanting, constantly unfurling music. Ão’s songs are texturally rich odysseys where electronic music, dream pop, saudade, ambient folk and neojazz constantly shape-shift: habitually in the most surprising, emotionally resonant ways.
Festival Bio (EN): Belgian formation Ão’s debut album ‘Ao Mar’ is Portuguese for ‘to the sea’.It’s hard to imagine a more apt way to describe their enchanting, constantly unfurling music. Ão’s songs are texturally rich odysseys where electronic music, dream pop, saudade, ambient folk and neojazz constantly shape-shift: habitually in the most surprising, emotionally resonant ways.

Bio: Aldous Harding is a New Zealand singer-songwriter known for her enigmatic and theatrical performances. Her music blends folk and alternative influences, characterized by haunting vocals and poetic lyricism, earning critical acclaim and a dedicated following.
My take: Harding's unique vocal delivery and ability to weave intricate, emotive narratives through her music set her apart in the indie folk scene. Her albums, such as 'Party' and 'Designer,' showcase her experimental approach and artistic depth.
Festival Bio (EN): Aldous Harding is one of those rare shapeshifting artists that comes along every so often.Sometimes in the very same song, she can be theatrical, comedic, soothing and frightening in a heartbeat – leaving audiences catching their breath on what could happen next. Since Harding's 2019 breakthrough album Designer, her mystique and magnetism only seems to have grown, writing songs that often capture the phenomena inside the gaps of living we tend to overlook.

Bio: Amaarae is a Ghanaian-American singer, songwriter, and producer known for her genre-blending sound that fuses Afropop, R&B, and Alté influences. Her debut album, 'The Angel You Don’t Know,' received critical acclaim for its innovative production and bold exploration of themes like identity and sexuality.
My take: Amaarae's distinctive sound combines sultry R&B vocals with experimental Afropop and Alté rhythms, creating a unique and boundary-pushing musical identity. Her work is celebrated for its boldness and fresh approach to contemporary African music.
Festival Bio (EN): Born in the Bronx with Ghanaian roots, this fast-rising producer, songwriter and vocalist pens sweltering tracks that are both ethereal and club-ready. Amaarae's transatlantic R&B/Afrobeat hybrid pop is rooted in highlife, baile funk and dance music, yet bares a non-conformist, playful streak that trail blazes straight into the future.

Tagline: Balmy blend of Thai music & electronics
Bio: Apichat Pakwan is a Dutch-Thai collective that blends traditional Isan (Northeastern Thai) music with modern electronic beats, creating a unique fusion of cultural and contemporary sounds. Their work often incorporates traditional Thai instruments like the khaen alongside electronic production, earning them recognition in the global music scene.
My take: Their innovative fusion of traditional Isan music with electronic production results in a vibrant and culturally rich sound, standing out in the global electronic music landscape.
Festival Bio (EN): Apichat Pakwan brings a lively crossover of electronics and Thai esan and molam movements: the sweetest balance between the modern and the traditional.It unfolds miraculously live as well: you have producer Olivier Schreuder serving up beats that blend seamlessly with the Thai musicians and singers: not in that crude mash-up kind of way, but warmly courting each other in a tryst. This approach carries over to audiences, creating a hot & sweltering dancefloor environment.

Bio: Ata Kak is a Ghanaian musician whose unique blend of highlife, hip-hop, and electronic music gained global recognition after his 1994 album 'Obaa Sima' was rediscovered and reissued by the label Awesome Tapes From Africa in 2015. His music is characterized by lo-fi production, infectious rhythms, and his distinctive vocal delivery.
My take: Ata Kak's fusion of traditional Ghanaian highlife with 90s hip-hop beats and lo-fi electronic production creates a sound that is both nostalgic and ahead of its time, making him a cult figure in global music circles.
Festival Bio (EN): Ata Kak’s rise as cult phenomenon shows us the power of Doing It Yourself – how it can cultivate some completely original pop music.Yaw Atta-Owusu knew he liked reggae music, he liked funk, he liked Ghanaian high life music, and he liked Grandmaster Flash. But why pick just one? With the necessary recording equipment, his signature Twi flow and an unblemished zest for life, Ata Kak’s legendary LP Obaa Sima became a global grassroots success. And we're still dancing feverishly to its tunes today.

Bio: BCUC (Bantu Continua Uhuru Consciousness) is a South African band known for their fusion of traditional South African music with modern genres like funk, hip-hop, and punk, creating a powerful and politically charged sound. Their music often features hypnotic rhythms, chants, and socially conscious lyrics, earning them international acclaim and a strong presence in the global festival circuit.
My take: BCUC's ability to blend traditional South African sounds with contemporary genres results in a raw, energetic, and deeply engaging musical experience. Their live performances are particularly notable for their intensity and communal spirit, making them a standout act in world music.
Festival Bio (EN): The Afropsychedelic pounce of Bantu Continua Uhuru Consciousness screams with a zealous, ceremonial spirit.BCUC's formula seems so simple when you break it down: bass, drums, percussion, voice chants all conspiring to spark frantic, joyous movement. And the Soweto, South-Africa based collective does this better than anyone: this is music awakened from ancient lineage, yet visionary, loud and transcending convention of what a band can be.

Tagline: One of death metal's most visionary bands
Bio: Blood Incantation is a death metal band from Denver, Colorado, known for their intricate compositions blending technical death metal with progressive and atmospheric elements. Since their formation in 2011, they have gained critical acclaim for albums like 'Starspawn' and 'Hidden History of the Human Race,' which showcase their cosmic themes and complex songwriting.
My take: Blood Incantation's fusion of technical death metal with progressive and space-themed elements creates a distinctive sound that pushes the boundaries of the genre. Their ability to balance brutality with atmospheric depth has earned them a dedicated following and critical praise.
Festival Bio (EN): In their own words, death metal behemoths Blood Incantation make mystical music for mystical people.

Bio: Bruno Berle is a Brazilian singer-songwriter and multi-instrumentalist known for his intimate and melodic approach to Música Popular Brasileira (MPB) blended with indie influences. His music often features gentle vocals, intricate guitar work, and a minimalist yet emotive production style.
My take: Bruno Berle's ability to merge traditional Brazilian MPB with contemporary indie aesthetics creates a soothing and introspective soundscape, making his work stand out in the global indie music scene.
Festival Bio (EN): From accounts of people who have been to Brazil, it does seem like time works differently over there. Bruno Berle’s warm-blooded pop affirms this notion all the more. Carefree, soft around the edges and unhurried, Berle’s tunes embrace you with the kind of affinity of a home-cooked meal. For you lovers out there, Bruno’s set at Best Kept would be good time to get cosy.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Fontaines D.C., The Murder Capital, Sprints, Gurriers... and now, Croíthe appear to be the next to grab the baton.Great bands from Ireland seem sprout to the surface just about every second these days: Croíthe bring that darkly romantic, prowling goth/shoegaze sensibility that will make fans of Bauhaus, Sisters Of Mercy and fellow Dublin-dwellers Just Mustard salivate.
Festival Bio (EN): Fontaines D.C., The Murder Capital, Sprints, Gurriers... and now, Croíthe appear to be the next to grab the baton.Great bands from Ireland seem sprout to the surface just about every second these days: Croíthe bring that darkly romantic, prowling goth/shoegaze sensibility that will make fans of Bauhaus, Sisters Of Mercy and fellow Dublin-dwellers Just Mustard salivate.

Tagline: Modern soul man with deep bag
Bio: Curtis Harding is an American singer-songwriter known for his unique fusion of soul, R&B, and psychedelic rock. He gained critical acclaim with his debut album 'Soul Power' in 2014 and has since been recognized for his retro-inspired sound and emotive performances.
My take: Harding's ability to blend vintage soul with modern influences creates a timeless yet innovative sound, drawing comparisons to legends like Curtis Mayfield while maintaining his own distinct identity.
Festival Bio (EN): With a cool you simply can’t teach, Curtis Harding instills his honed psychedelic sound with pure soul, gospel, garage and funk.Harding has made a habit out of stepping into new musical situations like a wide-eyed student – only to seemlessly absorb them as if they're always part of his DNA. A true chameleon who keeps on shining in whatever musical context he operates – his sights perpetually set on the next time he shuffles his now extensive deck of influences.

Bio: Dame Area is a Barcelona-based duo known for their unique blend of industrial rhythms, minimal synth, and tribal percussion, creating a hypnotic and raw sound. Their music often features repetitive patterns and primal energy, drawing inspiration from both post-punk and experimental electronic traditions.
My take: Their fusion of industrial textures with tribal and minimal synth elements results in a visceral and captivating sound, standing out for its raw intensity and experimental edge.
Festival Bio (EN): Remember that one Death Grips-lyric about having the DNA of gothic lemons? It describes Barcelona industrial duo Dame Area to a tee.Their sound is both abrasive and strangely whimsical: hissy, static-laden textures, bile-drenched polyrhythms and shouty vocals that sound like they've been recorded in claustrophobic solitary confinement. Dame Area put a fresh and fun spin on industrial music, marrying 'rave' and 'ravenous' in novel, eye-opening ways.

Tagline: Aussie soul hunk with vintage sound
Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] In the immortal words of Arthur Conley: ‘Do you like good music/ That sweet soul music?’ Australian singer Don West certainly does.
Festival Bio (EN): In the immortal words of Arthur Conley: ‘Do you like good music/ That sweet soul music?’ Australian singer Don West certainly does.

Tagline: The queen of Southern gothic folk pop
Bio: Ethel Cain is the moniker of American singer-songwriter Hayden Anhedönia, whose music blends elements of gothic Americana, dream pop, and ambient. Her debut album 'Preacher's Daughter' (2022) received critical acclaim for its haunting storytelling and deeply personal exploration of themes like religion, family, and identity.
My take: Ethel Cain's music is a haunting fusion of gothic Americana and dream pop, with her debut album 'Preacher's Daughter' standing out for its cinematic storytelling and emotionally raw lyricism, earning her a distinctive place in contemporary indie music.
Festival Bio (EN): Ethel Cain is one of pop music's most thrilling storytellers, in both the mainstream and the fringes.

Tagline: Bombshell blender of rap, post-punk & indie
Bio: Genesis Owusu is a Ghanaian-Australian artist known for his genre-defying blend of hip hop, funk, and soul, often infused with socially conscious themes. His debut album 'Smiling with No Teeth' received critical acclaim, winning multiple ARIA Awards and establishing him as a unique voice in contemporary music.
My take: Genesis Owusu's ability to seamlessly merge genres like hip hop, funk, and soul with introspective and socially charged lyrics sets him apart as a bold and innovative artist. His dynamic performances and experimental sound have earned him widespread critical acclaim.
Festival Bio (EN): One of his LPs might be called Struggler, the way Ghanaian/Australian artist Genesis Owusu mixes styles like post-punk, rap, pop, funk and electro feels downright effortless.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] This sense of abandon morphs into a thrifty mix of eighties pop, post-punk, and classic rock that’s frequently been dubbed as ‘power disco’. Indeed, these two freewheeling Bristolians seem to make it up as they go along, and it often unfolds in similar comedic brilliance as in that famous sitcom “Peep Show”. A love for all things music-related, from Chic to AC/DC, is worn on Getdown Services' furrowed sleeves.
Festival Bio (EN): This sense of abandon morphs into a thrifty mix of eighties pop, post-punk, and classic rock that’s frequently been dubbed as ‘power disco’. Indeed, these two freewheeling Bristolians seem to make it up as they go along, and it often unfolds in similar comedic brilliance as in that famous sitcom “Peep Show”. A love for all things music-related, from Chic to AC/DC, is worn on Getdown Services' furrowed sleeves.

Bio: Ghost Woman is a Canadian musical project led by Evan Uschenko, known for its lo-fi, vintage-inspired psychedelic rock sound that draws heavily from 60s and 70s garage rock influences. The project has gained attention for its raw, analog production and hypnotic, groove-driven tracks.
My take: Ghost Woman's music stands out for its authentic retro aesthetic, blending jangly guitars, reverb-soaked vocals, and a hazy, nostalgic atmosphere reminiscent of classic psych-rock bands.
Festival Bio (EN): No genre has been declared dead more than rock; yet the duo of GHOSTWOMAN fancies itself as fiery necromancers, reinventing its raw power all over again.Canadian Evan Uschenko (guitars/vocals) and Belgian Ille van Dessel (drums/percussion) began their voyage an entire ocean apart: now their collision course brings new tremors in activity, exploring rock of the psychedelic, stoner, garage and indie variety through the prism of their own infectious chemistry.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] If music was somehow a math equation unlocking the fifth dimension in space, Grote Geelstaart are the kind of band to figure it out, using odd time signatures, riffs that scream 'fuck you, diatonic scale!', and a lot of sweating it out through three-piece suits. Grote Geelstaart's music will flop like fish out of water, only to magically grow arms and legs on the spot: rock music evolving in real time!
Festival Bio (EN): If music was somehow a math equation unlocking the fifth dimension in space, Grote Geelstaart are the kind of band to figure it out, using odd time signatures, riffs that scream 'fuck you, diatonic scale!', and a lot of sweating it out through three-piece suits. Grote Geelstaart's music will flop like fish out of water, only to magically grow arms and legs on the spot: rock music evolving in real time!

Bio: Hayley Williams is an American singer, songwriter, and musician best known as the lead vocalist and primary songwriter of the Grammy-winning rock band Paramore. She has also released solo work, showcasing a more introspective and experimental pop sound.
My take: Hayley Williams' dynamic vocal range and ability to shift between high-energy pop punk anthems and introspective, experimental solo work make her a standout artist in modern rock and alternative music.
Festival Bio (EN): From fronting pop punk icons Paramore to spearheading an illustrious solo career, Hayley Williams's artistic walk of life is both singular and inspiring.Williams influenced a whole generation of stars, from Billie Eilish to Olivia Rodrigo – and the damnedest thing happened: those artists reinvigorated her work in return. The 17 song release Ego Death At a Bachelorette Party is as multi-faceted and free spirited as pop music gets – plus a rare shining example of a grassroots and community-driven project on a mainstream level. This is why Hayley Williams is truly our favorite band.

Tagline: Amsterdam's most notorious club culture omnivore
Bio: Job Jobse is a Dutch DJ and producer known for his eclectic and emotive sets that blend house, techno, and disco influences. He has performed at major festivals like Dekmantel and has held residencies at renowned clubs such as De School in Amsterdam.
My take: Job Jobse's ability to seamlessly mix euphoric house, driving techno, and nostalgic disco makes his sets both dynamic and emotionally resonant, earning him a reputation as one of the most versatile DJs in the electronic music scene.
Festival Bio (EN): From graveyard shifts at legendary club Trouw to becoming one of the most renowned DJs worldwide, Job Jobse’s life is a metronome-driven pipe dream.

Bio: Joey Valence & Brae are an American duo blending old-school hip-hop influences with modern production, characterized by energetic beats and humorous, high-energy performances. Their music draws inspiration from 1990s rap styles, creating a nostalgic yet fresh sound.
My take: Their fusion of 90s hip-hop with contemporary production techniques results in a vibrant, playful sound that stands out for its nostalgic appeal and dynamic energy.
Festival Bio (EN): Joey Valence & Brae's tracks are jam packed with nerdy references to pop culture, memes, and games. They perform that sweet sample-based old-skool rap style with the almost endless possibilities of today. For example, the two childhood friends shot the video for Punk Tactics entirely on a Nintendo DS. Such fun stunts have earned Joey Valence & Brae a legion of millions of fans.

Bio: Jungle By Night is a nine-piece instrumental band from the Netherlands, blending Afrobeat, funk, jazz, and psychedelic influences to create a dynamic and energetic sound. They have gained international recognition for their electrifying live performances and have performed at major festivals like North Sea Jazz and Lowlands.
My take: Their ability to seamlessly fuse Afrobeat grooves with jazz and funk elements results in a vibrant and infectious sound, making them a standout in the global instrumental music scene.
Festival Bio (EN): Synergy isn't just the name of a recent collaborative project Jungle By Night sunk their teeth in – it is truly who they are.Jungle By Night has explored virtually every musical style imaginable with thorough, thoughtful cross-pollination. Dub, krautrock, psychedelic rock, pop, dance, afrobeat, hip-hop, funk, and electronic music all feature in the groundbreaking vocabulary of this vital collective. Few can bring all those rich influences together and make people move in ways they never deemed possible.

Bio: Leoniden is a German indie rock band known for their energetic live performances and a sound that blends catchy melodies with elements of funk, pop, and punk. Since their formation in 2014, they have gained a strong following in Europe with critically acclaimed albums like 'Again' and 'Complex Happenings Reduced to a Simple Design'.
My take: Leoniden's dynamic fusion of indie rock with funk and punk influences creates an infectious, high-energy sound that translates exceptionally well to their live shows, earning them a reputation as one of Germany's most exciting modern rock bands.
Festival Bio (EN): Sentimentality becomes the most epic of quests with German indie-punk outfit Leoniden: anthems crammed with pure-hearted, euphoric adrenaline.Such punching-the-air fanfare needs an equally powerful foil, which arrives in the shape of disarmingly frank, unpolished lyricism, bringing a depth and nuance that underpins the group's hard-hitting sound. Leoniden is a no-holds-barred, no-compromise, leaving-it-all-on-the-floor operation, and we can never have enough bands like this.

Tagline: Genre-blending DJ who brings that rare dancefloor euphoria
Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] If one is forced to narrow down a Lucky Done Gone DJ set in just two terms, it would be ‘carefree and contagious’.
Festival Bio (EN): If one is forced to narrow down a Lucky Done Gone DJ set in just two terms, it would be ‘carefree and contagious’.

Bio: Mac DeMarco is a Canadian singer-songwriter, multi-instrumentalist, and producer known for his laid-back, jangly guitar-driven sound and unique 'slacker rock' aesthetic. His critically acclaimed albums, such as 'Salad Days' and 'This Old Dog,' have earned him a devoted following and solidified his reputation as a pioneer of modern indie music.
My take: Mac DeMarco's music is characterized by its mellow, nostalgic vibe, blending jangly guitars with introspective lyrics and a quirky, DIY production style. His ability to craft catchy yet emotionally resonant songs has made him a standout figure in the indie music scene.
Festival Bio (EN): In the vast outstretched lands of British Columbia, Mac is a man who enjoys his canoeing, his riding of motorcycles and his building of water wells. And by the way, he pens a lot of great jams as well. Hence his latest work, coincidently called ‘Guitar’, is as pure of heart as its creator. Though it seems like Mac is forever winging it, his unmistakable wisdom and wry humor always simmer through.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Within the dusky, nocturnal songs of mark william lewis you can untangle head and heart at your own desired pace.Blessed with a deep baritone and a talent for painting scenes with through minimal means, it’s no wonder art house film giant A24 decided to ink the UK songwriter to a record deal. There is a gothic mystery lingering in lewis's songs, a love for electronic music, rap, grime and indie rock permeating through. An artist whose romanticism and fluidity are understated, yet undeniably magnetic.
Festival Bio (EN): Within the dusky, nocturnal songs of mark william lewis you can untangle head and heart at your own desired pace.Blessed with a deep baritone and a talent for painting scenes with through minimal means, it’s no wonder art house film giant A24 decided to ink the UK songwriter to a record deal. There is a gothic mystery lingering in lewis's songs, a love for electronic music, rap, grime and indie rock permeating through. An artist whose romanticism and fluidity are understated, yet undeniably magnetic.

Tagline: Rap spirituals of a different caliber
Bio: MAVI is an American rapper known for his introspective lyrics and jazzy, lo-fi production. He gained critical acclaim with his 2019 debut album 'Let the Sun Talk' and has been recognized for his poetic approach to hip-hop.
My take: MAVI's intricate lyricism and soulful, jazz-infused beats set him apart in the modern hip-hop scene, drawing comparisons to artists like Earl Sweatshirt while maintaining a distinct voice.
Festival Bio (EN): In both style and substance, the Charlotte-born rapper has truly proven himself in a league of his own: impressionistic, ambitious, experimental and community driven. It has put two modern classics, Laughing so Hard, it Hurts (2022) and its mirage-like follow-up, shadowbox (2024), on the map. Indeed, the sky is in Mavi’s future… and the very limit of what he can achieve.

Tagline: Dutch pop's Most Entertaining Role Model
Bio: MEROL is a Dutch pop artist known for her witty, bold lyrics and catchy electropop sound. She has gained significant attention for her humorous and empowering songs that often tackle themes of modern relationships, sexuality, and self-expression.
My take: MEROL's playful yet socially conscious lyrics, combined with her infectious electropop production, make her a standout voice in contemporary Dutch pop music. Her ability to blend humor with commentary on societal norms sets her apart.
Festival Bio (EN): As the pre-eminent risk taker within the Dutch mainstream, you can always count on MEROL fearlessly plunge into the deepest end.The imagery of a shark – the creature she depicts on latest LP Naar De Haaien & Weer Terug – makes a lot of sense: MEROL can breach the surface with razor-sharp, risque EDM bangers, but also express the introspective struggle below with layered pop gems. Both on stage and on her records, fun, danger and vulnerability are MEROL's favorite bedfellows.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] The kids are not only embracing shoegaze – they are taking it to someplace new. Midrift pepper in a bit of emo and pop punk to make things interesting.The path of these phenoms is not like some of their forebears, toiling away with raggedy house shows at first. Frontman Gus Mehrkam created his songs in his bedroom, uploaded them on TikTok, and bang! They became viral hits. With skirmishing siblings Kai and Manoa Neukermans completing the power trio, Midrift are justly what people call 'an overnight sensation'.
Festival Bio (EN): The kids are not only embracing shoegaze – they are taking it to someplace new. Midrift pepper in a bit of emo and pop punk to make things interesting.The path of these phenoms is not like some of their forebears, toiling away with raggedy house shows at first. Frontman Gus Mehrkam created his songs in his bedroom, uploaded them on TikTok, and bang! They became viral hits. With skirmishing siblings Kai and Manoa Neukermans completing the power trio, Midrift are justly what people call 'an overnight sensation'.

Bio: Militarie Gun is a Los Angeles-based band that blends hardcore punk energy with melodic alternative rock influences. Known for their emotionally charged lyrics and dynamic performances, they have gained attention for their fresh take on punk music.
My take: Militarie Gun combines the raw aggression of hardcore punk with a melodic sensibility reminiscent of 90s alternative rock, creating a sound that is both intense and accessible. Their ability to balance ferocity with hooks has earned them a growing reputation in the punk and indie scenes.
Festival Bio (EN): Militarie Gun convert hard luck tales into rousing, satisfying releases like few other bands can.Founded by frontman Ian Shelton, these American post-hardcore innovators restlessly seek out small blades of hope and vulnerability peering out from the hard-paved realities. They show that revolt isn’t just about shouting at the masses: illustrating one’s daily concerns and struggles can strike just as urgently.

Bio: Model/Actriz is a Brooklyn-based band known for their intense, high-energy performances and a sound that blends noise rock with industrial and experimental elements. Their music often explores themes of identity, desire, and chaos, creating a visceral and immersive experience.
My take: Model/Actriz delivers a raw, frenetic energy through their abrasive yet danceable sound, drawing comparisons to acts like Daughters and Liars while carving out their own niche in the experimental rock scene.
Festival Bio (EN): Swans, Sonic Youth, the whole no wave movement – New York has always been fertile ground for loud music, and Model/Actriz are enjoying the buffet.This band brings a different type of flair to the fore: have you ever imagined Gomez Addams fronting Nine Inch Nails, or Marc Almond featuring on a Gilla Band album? The mix of deafening noise and vaudevillian charm make Model/Actriz impossible to resist: their shows trigger a fundamental need for pure catharsis.

Bio: Mula B is a Dutch rapper known for his gritty lyrics and energetic delivery, often blending street narratives with catchy hooks. He gained prominence in the Dutch hip-hop scene with hits like 'Domme Jongens' and collaborations with other prominent artists.
My take: Mula B's raw and dynamic style, combined with his ability to craft memorable hooks, has made him a standout in the Dutch hip-hop scene. His music often reflects urban life with an authentic and unfiltered perspective.
Festival Bio (EN): Mula B and his intoxicating genre-blending narco pop blueprint are changing the entire Dutch rap game.If you walk the streets at night in any city, you hear all sorts of music fading in and out of each other – indie, pop, psychedelic rock, rap, reggaeton. Mula B adopted this miscellany to his own kitchen sink hip-hop tales and kaboom, suddenly, he became one of the most revitalising performers of the Low Countries. And we’re sure glad to have Mula B back in Hilvarenbeek.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Mên An Tol are named after an ancient rock formation in their native Cornish, which may tell you something about their overall approach to rock music.
Festival Bio (EN): Mên An Tol are named after an ancient rock formation in their native Cornish, which may tell you something about their overall approach to rock music.

Bio: Nation of Language is a Brooklyn-based band known for their blend of 80s-inspired synthpop and post-punk, drawing comparisons to acts like New Order and OMD. Their music features lush synthesizers, driving basslines, and introspective lyrics, earning them critical acclaim in the indie music scene.
My take: Nation of Language masterfully channels the spirit of 80s synthpop with a modern edge, creating emotionally resonant tracks that feel both nostalgic and fresh. Their sound is marked by a balance of melancholic melodies and danceable rhythms.
Festival Bio (EN): After Kraftwerk, New Order, and LCD Soundsystem passed the baton, now Nation Of Language upholds the continuum of new wave and synth pop greatness.The New York band's latest LP Dance Called Memory, poetically enough, grasps retroactively with how one wishes to be remembered, its songs emphasising physicality, impermanence and flaw over artifice and perfection. We're pleased to bring Nation Of Language back to Best Kept Secret's lakeside scenery.

Bio: NewDad is an indie rock band from Galway, Ireland, known for their dreamy, melancholic sound that blends ethereal vocals with lush guitar textures. Since their formation in 2018, they have gained attention for their introspective lyrics and atmospheric production, drawing comparisons to bands like The Cure and Slowdive.
My take: NewDad's ability to craft emotionally resonant songs with shimmering, shoegaze-inspired instrumentation and heartfelt lyrics sets them apart in the indie rock scene. Their music captures a nostalgic yet fresh sound that appeals to fans of both classic and modern dream pop.
Festival Bio (EN): Kids are rummaging parents’ music collections, and subsequently starting cool new bands. You can add Irish indie rockers NewDad to that crop.Those tried and true sounds clashing head on with restless, radical youth makes for something unspeakbly fresh. NewDad's gloomy but playful concoction of grunge, shoegaze and dream pop is likewise brimming with brilliant melodies and a lightning-in-the bottle energy that's hard to match.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] There’s a fuzzy sentiment to Parker Fans’ self-described ‘three-way boogie bromance’, shuffling styles with a magpie’s spirit.Gabber house flirtations, hip-hop hoedowns, breakbeat bonanzas: this Dutch trio has a knack for courting all kinds of unexpected chaos – often of the gleeful variety. Fully aware of the futility of having too much fun, Parker Fans are squiggly, scatterbrained and compulsively scene-causing.
Festival Bio (EN): There’s a fuzzy sentiment to Parker Fans’ self-described ‘three-way boogie bromance’, shuffling styles with a magpie’s spirit.Gabber house flirtations, hip-hop hoedowns, breakbeat bonanzas: this Dutch trio has a knack for courting all kinds of unexpected chaos – often of the gleeful variety. Fully aware of the futility of having too much fun, Parker Fans are squiggly, scatterbrained and compulsively scene-causing.

Bio: Sammy Virji is a UK-based DJ and producer known for his vibrant take on UK Garage and House music. He has gained recognition for his energetic live performances and infectious tracks, which blend classic garage sounds with modern electronic influences.
My take: Sammy Virji's ability to modernize UK Garage with playful, bass-heavy beats and catchy melodies has made him a standout figure in the genre. His music is both nostalgic and forward-thinking, appealing to fans of classic garage and contemporary dance music alike.
Festival Bio (EN): Over the past eight years, he's expanded his discography and created an unforgettable live show. After his iconic single "Shella Verse" featuring Flowdan and his viral DJ Mag stream, he's become an indispensable part of the dance world. With his new album, "If U Need It," he's steadily growing his fan base. Sammy is bringing UKG to a wider audience while simultaneously developing and refining his own sound.

Tagline: One of Dutch rap's chief voices
Bio: Sef, born Yousef Gnaoui, is a Dutch rapper and singer known for his melodic approach to hip-hop and his ability to blend rap with pop and electronic influences. He gained recognition as part of the rap group Flinke Namen before embarking on a successful solo career, releasing albums like 'El Salvador' and 'In Kleur' that showcase his introspective lyrics and genre-blending sound.
My take: Sef's ability to fuse introspective lyrics with pop and electronic elements sets him apart in the Dutch hip-hop scene, offering a versatile and polished sound that appeals to a broad audience.
Festival Bio (EN): With his deeply impressive performances on big festival stages last summer, and a sold-out club tour still fresh in our minds, Sef has solidified himself as one of Dutch rap’s leading lights. From his beloved hip-hop staple De Leven to latest LP lieve monsters – a dark but danceable tale of collective despair – Yousef Gnaoui enters Best Kept Secret with a surplus of stories, stirring energy and moments that’ll stick with you.

Tagline: Fiery mix of hip-hop, post-punk and electronics
Bio: Shady Nasty is a Sydney-based band blending post-punk, hip-hop, and experimental elements to create a unique and gritty sound. Their music often explores themes of urban life and youth culture, delivered with raw energy and unconventional arrangements.
My take: Their fusion of post-punk's angular intensity with hip-hop's rhythmic sensibilities creates a distinctive and edgy sound, reflecting the complexities of modern urban experiences.
Festival Bio (EN): Add a Fred again.. to your list of fans, and things suddenly travel at warp-speed. This is exactly what happened to Australian act Shady Nasty.Frankly, the enthusiasm is entirely justified, because Shady Nasty's sound is as immediately bewitching as its tricky to define. Their adventurous productions slither in that liminal space between post-punk and hip-hop, with lyrics candidly channeling the everyday grind. Shady Nasty is already a cross-cultural marvel to truly reckon with.

Artist: Sharon van Etten & The Attachment Theory
Tagline: One of indie rock's most powerful voices
Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Sharon van Etten has come a long way: through peaks and valleys, in times of coming-of-age, devastation, collaboration, and triumph.Yet we continue to be surprised by the myriad ways her expressive voice overtakes us. Next to being one of the most influential & era-defining songwriters of her era, Van Etten is a true polymath, making her presence known in the fields of photography, dance, film and psychology in equal measure.
Festival Bio (EN): Sharon van Etten has come a long way: through peaks and valleys, in times of coming-of-age, devastation, collaboration, and triumph.Yet we continue to be surprised by the myriad ways her expressive voice overtakes us. Next to being one of the most influential & era-defining songwriters of her era, Van Etten is a true polymath, making her presence known in the fields of photography, dance, film and psychology in equal measure.

Bio: Skullcrusher is the musical project of Helen Ballentine, an American singer-songwriter known for her introspective lyrics and ethereal soundscapes. Her music blends delicate acoustic arrangements with dreamy, melancholic tones, drawing comparisons to artists like Phoebe Bridgers and Sufjan Stevens.
My take: Skullcrusher's ability to craft intimate, hauntingly beautiful songs with understated instrumentation and poignant storytelling has garnered critical acclaim, making her a standout in the indie folk and dream pop genres.
Festival Bio (EN): Funny thing: the Skullcrusher moniker was hatched by Helen Ballentine when she started a DJ project mixing My Bloody Valentine and Autechre. When that didn't pan out, it just stuck when she decided to pen haunting finger-picking folk songs that seem to exist inside of a David Lynch or Kiyoshi Kurasawa picture. Skullcrusher expertly treads a fine line between beauty and devastation.

Bio: Sophie Straat is a Dutch singer known for her modern take on the traditional 'levenslied' genre, blending socially conscious lyrics with a nostalgic yet contemporary sound. Her music often addresses political and social issues, resonating with a younger audience while paying homage to classic Dutch folk traditions.
My take: Sophie Straat's ability to modernize the Dutch levenslied with sharp social commentary and a retro-inspired sound makes her a unique voice in contemporary Dutch music. Her work bridges generational gaps and brings fresh relevance to a traditional genre.
Festival Bio (EN): The Amsterdam-based protest singer is a savvy satirist who possesses immense talent for addressing the ills of the world with maximum entertainment. Stylistically, she veers from Dutch smartlap folk to punk rock on a whim – often with message attached. All-embracing and eternally on the frontlines against injustice, Sophie Straat is one of the most unique and outspoken voices in Dutch pop.

Tagline: Indie rock with a novelistic bite
Bio: Sorry is a London-based band known for their experimental approach to indie rock, blending elements of grunge, electronic, and jazz influences. Their critically acclaimed debut album '925' (2020) showcased their genre-defying sound and lyrical depth.
My take: Sorry's ability to seamlessly merge grungy guitars, electronic textures, and introspective lyrics sets them apart in the indie rock scene. Their innovative sound and strong critical reception make them a standout act.
Festival Bio (EN): Sorry imbue their cinematic & angular indie rock with the storytelling prowess of a distinguished novelist.Seedy tales of the city, the taboos of love and sex, the horrors of post-modern living – Asha Lorenz and Louis O’ Bryen intend to unpack it all. The band’s fantastic latest LP Cosplay unmasks both their inner tensions and the pretenses of the outside world.

Bio: [using festival bio due to a lack of publicly available data] Tanzania's Zawose Queens channel vibrations of the ancestors through their rapturous polyphonic singing.As the daughter and granddaughter of the legendary Dr. Hukwe Zawose, Leah and Pendo are ushering in the family tradition as its first female practitioners. Their fusion of the Gogo music and modern-day electronics expresses a deep connection towards nature, to ceremony and to ritual: music teeming with unshakable spirit and fire.
Festival Bio (EN): Tanzania's Zawose Queens channel vibrations of the ancestors through their rapturous polyphonic singing.As the daughter and granddaughter of the legendary Dr. Hukwe Zawose, Leah and Pendo are ushering in the family tradition as its first female practitioners. Their fusion of the Gogo music and modern-day electronics expresses a deep connection towards nature, to ceremony and to ritual: music teeming with unshakable spirit and fire.

Bio: Tramhaus is a Rotterdam-based post-punk band known for their raw energy and politically charged lyrics, blending angular guitar riffs with a driving rhythm section to create a visceral live experience.
My take: Their sound captures the essence of classic post-punk while infusing it with a modern edge, marked by intense performances and socially conscious themes.
Festival Bio (EN): At a blistering pace, Tramhaus snowballed from Rotterdam’s latest post-punk curiosity to one of Europe’s greatest rock bands.And with two legendary shows at Best Kept Secret already under the group's belt, it makes perfect sense to invite them back for another noisy merry-go-round. Beneath all those powerhouse riffs, blunt force trauma, and indefatigable DIY spirit, Tramhaus are a band with a big beating heart, and a special knack for making audiences feel present, seen and loved.

Bio: Tropical Fuck Storm is an Australian band known for their chaotic, experimental rock sound that blends elements of art punk, noise rock, and post-punk. Formed in 2017 by members of The Drones, they have gained critical acclaim for their inventive songwriting and intense live performances.
My take: Their music combines abrasive guitar work, unconventional song structures, and darkly satirical lyrics, creating a distinctive and uncompromising sound that challenges traditional rock norms.
Festival Bio (EN): Imagine all of your favorite rock bands melted down into some sort of stenchy primordial soup, only to rise and reform.

Bio: Weval is a Dutch electronic music duo consisting of Harm Coolen and Merijn Scholte Albers, known for their emotive and genre-blurring sound that combines elements of electronic, indie, and downtempo music. They have gained acclaim for their intricate productions and dynamic live performances, releasing music on the renowned Kompakt label.
My take: Weval's music stands out for its rich textures and emotional depth, blending lush electronic soundscapes with organic instrumentation and subtle vocal elements. Their live performances are celebrated for their immersive and atmospheric quality.
Festival Bio (EN): There's an immense care this Dutch duo put into their chosen craft – and a surrender to one’s deepest listening instincts.Those two methods are part of the Weval magic – the studious tinkering vs. the spontaneity of live instrumentation, until that sweet innuendo between the artificial and the organic is achieved. Through headphones and across the dancefloors, Weval remains an ever-sublime and satisfying operation, renowned across all corners of the world.

Bio: Wolf Alice is a British alternative rock band formed in London in 2010. Known for their dynamic sound that blends grunge, folk, and dream pop, they have received critical acclaim, including a Mercury Prize win for their 2017 album 'Visions of a Life'.
My take: Wolf Alice's ability to seamlessly transition between ethereal melodies and gritty, guitar-driven anthems sets them apart in the alternative rock scene. Their genre-blending sound and emotionally resonant lyrics have solidified their reputation as one of the most versatile and compelling bands of their generation.
Festival Bio (EN): Their latest LP The Clearing luxuriates in aspects of some of rock music’s greatest – the melodic genius of Fleetwood Mac, the glam rock strut of T-Rex, the technicolor exuberance of ELO. Wolf Alice have plenty of classics to call their own: how many songs capture both the devastation and thrill of falling in love better than “Don’t Delete The Kisses”? Best Kept Secret has felt this thrill many times before. Safe to say, that third post-show dip in the lake’s a charm.

Bio: Yard Act is a British post-punk band from Leeds, known for their sharp, satirical lyrics and minimalist instrumentation. Their debut album 'The Overload' (2022) received critical acclaim and was shortlisted for the Mercury Prize.
My take: Yard Act's witty, socially observant lyrics paired with their raw, angular post-punk sound make them a standout in the modern UK music scene. Their debut album showcases a clever blend of humor and critique, drawing comparisons to acts like The Fall and Sleaford Mods.
Festival Bio (EN): From boy bands, cowbell disco to MacBeth, nothing is excluded in the wonderfully witty pocket world of Yard Act.Initially breaking in the post-punk revival's slipstream, Yard Act quickly separated themselves from the pack of soapbox-shouters with their charmingly flawed character sketches, offbeat everyman humor and starry-eyed pop sensibility. On their latest LP Where's My Utopia? Yard Act remain as sincere as they are endlessly entertaining.
